sub_title: MBA Candidate | Lawyer | Renewable Energy & Sustainability
summary: Lawyer with 7+ years of experience enabling clients to develop, finance, build, and operate renewable energy projects, including onshore and offshore wind, solar, hydro, tidal, storage, and P2X. International experience supporting clients in North America, Latin America, and EMEA. Combine strong analytical abilities and attention-to-detail with a pragmatic, goal-oriented approach to project and transaction management. Collaborative, cooperative, and context-aware team player. Motivated to align my career with global efforts to accelerate the energy transition while creating shared social, environmental, and economic value.

[{'company': {'id': 37786, 'name': 'McInnes Cooper', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D560BAQGBgnSGUh2z2A/company-logo_400_400/0/1685990922568?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=SgtFT5AB5nmb6MdbSfDkLIMCkLQEmCXW6-JqKXgC-zw', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/mcinnescooper/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'company': 'McInnes Cooper', 'description': '• Co-managed transaction agendas, due diligence, and credit document drafting/ negotiations for 7 project finance transactions, resulting in clients securing +$250M to build +125MW of new renewable energy projects
• Co-managed 4 asset/ share purchase transactions for 65 MW of mature wind, solar, and hydro assets for proceeds of +$50M
• Drafted/ negotiated/ advised on MOUs, JV, and partnership agreements among global energy companies, IPPs, and Indigenous communities, establishing the foundation for 25+ multi-stakeholder partnerships
• Drafted/ negotiated/ advised on PPAs, TSAs, SMAs, BESS, EPC, leases, and other commercial contracts, enabling clients to develop, finance, build and operate projects on time, with less risk, and with streamlined legal processes
• Advised 4 global energy companies on Canadian laws, enabling them to confidently enter Canada’s emerging green hydrogen sector
• Researched, analyzed, and presented McInnes Cooper’s management team with recommendations on an optimal ESG framework, resulting in the firm joining the United Nations Global Compact (UNGC)
